Primary Contact: Amanda Barrett, Residential Manager; Phone: 250.575.9196; Fax: 778.436.9477; Email: amanda.barrett@jhscso.bc.ca
Service Details: - Operates 30 self-contained bachelor units of low income, supportive housing for adult men and women ages 19+ who are at risk of homelessness and/or are working towards managing mental health and/or substance misuse issues- Life skill development is a key support in integrating individual tenants to more independent housing in a two-year period
Eligibility: Ages: 19 year(s) and upMen or women who are homeless or at risk of being homeless and are working towards managing mental health and/or substance misuse issues
How to Apply: Please download the Supportive Housing Registration (SHR) Service form from our website and fax completed form to BC Housing’s Penticton office at 250.492.1080. You can also scan/email the application to their Health and Housing Coordinator, Ana Frias at interiorregion@bchousing.org.
Cost: $400 if recieving Ministry of Social Development & Social Innovation funding or Rent Geared to Income (30% of Gross Income) for those recieving alternative funding resources
Address & Map: Cardington Apartments1436 St. Paul St, #100Kelowna, BC     V1Y 2E6View MapQuest Map
Major Intersection: St Paul St and Bernard Ave
